info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 5:22AM EDT until April 5 at 6:06PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
Haw Creek near Clifford.
Clifty Creek at Hartsville.
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
Sugar Creek near Edinburgh.
.Recent multiple rounds of heavy rainfall have lead to minor flooding on several central Indiana streams and creeks that will continue through much of today and possibly tonight. Minor Flooding on Sugar Creek near Edinburgh is expected to rise to Moderate flooding late today...with moderate flooding forecast to continue near Edinburgh into Monday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Haw Creek near Clifford.
* WHEN...From early this morning to this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, Near major flooding in progress along Haw Creek. Flooded roads include CR 450 N, Rocky Ford Road, 10th Street and Marr Road according to Columbus Response Plan.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 13.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:30 AM EDT Saturday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 615 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING
